div.bibl: Dziennik Chicagoski, Dec. 1, 1921. FORTY HOURS DEVOTION

body.p: Forty Hours Devotion services at the of Mary's Church November 27, 22, and 23. At to time as the church From early morning to late evening both young and old kept .
The balustrade before the altars was willed with people who offered their prayers before the of God. After a short prayer, they returned to the pews for the ceremonials.

A procession of the Blessed Sacrament officially started the of the Forty Hours Devotion ceremony. Rev. appalt, pastor, officiated during the procession. He was assisted by Fr. S. Derwinski, who served
as deacon, and Rev. S. who was the sub-beacon.
The latter priest celebrated with The was officiated by Rev. B. Howakowski. The deacon was Fr. Francis Rusch and the sub deacon was Fr. John Kendziora.
All the sermons were given by Fr. from Pulaski, Wisconsin. and visiting assisted in the three day services.

The alter was decorated with fresh flowers and any deceorative The decoration were done by the nuns of the parish school. The church choir, under the direction of Stanislaus Mrozinski, local many beautiful hymns. At regular intervals, groups of children of would come to the church to pray and sing.
